change_description:

 before 4.0.

  the pre-4.0 APIs.

With Lucene 4.0, we are always on Java 6

iterate fields and add their size() instead.

   have this statistic per-field.

Only for reading CFS files from 3.x indexes.

This is here only to ease transition from
 the pre-4.0 APIs.
Use StandardTokenizer, CJKWidthFilter, CJKBigramFilter, and LowerCaseFilter instead.

 This analyzer will be removed in Lucene 5.0

UseStandardTokenizerFactoryinstead.
  This tokenizer has no Russian-specific functionality.
UseCollationKeyAnalyzer.CollationKeyAnalyzer(Version, Collator)and specify a version instead. This ctor will be removed in Lucene 5.0

UseICUCollationAttributeFactoryinstead, which encodes
  terms directly as bytes. This filter will be removed in Lucene 5.0
UseICUCollationKeyAnalyzer.ICUCollationKeyAnalyzer(Version, Collator)and specify a version instead. This ctor will be removed in Lucene 5.0
(4.1) This method will be removed in Lucene 5.0

This codec is read-only: as the functionality has been folded
 into the default codec. Its only for convenience to read old segments.
Only for reading old Appending segments

(4.4) PositionFilter makesTokenStreamgraphs inconsistent
             which can cause highlighting bugs. Its main use-case being to makeQueryParsergenerate boolean queries instead of phrase queries, it is now advised to useQueryParser.setAutoGeneratePhraseQueries(boolean)(for simple cases) or to overrideQueryParser.newFieldQuery.

change_description: Use a QueryWrapperFilteron a BooleanQuery instead
Use of this method can only lead to race conditions. Try to actually obtain a lock instead.
FilteredQuery will be removed in Lucene 6.0. It should be replaced with aBooleanQuerywith oneBooleanClause.Occur.MUSTclause for the query and oneBooleanClause.Occur.FILTERclause for the filter.
Boolean queries should be created once withBooleanQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeeBooleanQuery.Builder.add(org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanClause).
Boolean queries should be created once withBooleanQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeeBooleanQuery.Builder.add(org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanClause).
Phrase queries should be created once withPhraseQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeePhraseQuery.Builder.add(Term).
Phrase queries should be created once withPhraseQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeePhraseQuery.Builder.add(Term, int).
Use SleepingLockWrapper if you want sleeping.
Boolean queries should be created once withBooleanQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeeBooleanQuery.Builder.setMinimumNumberShouldMatch(int).
Phrase queries should be created once with PhraseQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeePhraseQuery.Builder.setSlop(int).
Use the BooleanQuery.Builderclass to build boolean queries.
Use the BooleanQuery.Builderclass to build boolean queries.
Use the PhraseQuery.Builderclass to build phrase queries.
This class will be removed in Lucene 6.0. DiversifiedTopDocsCollector should be used instead with a maximum number of hits per key equal to 1.
This class is not useful internally anymore and will be removed in 6.0
Use ClassicSimilarityfor equivilent behavior, or consider switching toBM25Similaritywhich will become the new default in Lucene 6.0

Use Queryobjects instead : when queries are wrapped in aConstantScoreQueryor in aBooleanClause.Occur.FILTERclause, they automatically disable the score computation so theFilterclass does not provide benefits compared to queries anymore.
This class is not useful internally anymore and will be removed in 6.0
You can useQueryobjects directly for filtering by usingBooleanClause.Occur.FILTERclauses in aBooleanQuery.
Use DisjunctionMaxQuery.DisjunctionMaxQuery(Collection, float) instead and provide all clauses at construction time
All clauses should be provided atconstruction-time.
per-query boosts are deprecated in favour ofBoostQuery
Cloning was only useful for modifying boosts. Now thatQuery.setBoost(float)is deprecated, queries should be considered immutable.
Use BoostQuery instead to apply boosts.
Use BoostQuery instead to apply boosts.
You should plug aQueryCacheintoIndexSearcher instead and let it make decisions.
Use DisjunctionMaxQuery.DisjunctionMaxQuery(Collection, float) instead and provide all clauses at construction time

Instead index withIntPoint,LongPoint,FloatPoint,DoublePoint, and create range queries withIntPoint.newRangeQuery(),LongPoint.newRangeQuery(),FloatPoint.newRangeQuery(),DoublePoint.newRangeQuery()respectively. SeePointValuesfor background information on Points.

change_id: 6.0.0_org.apache.lucene.search.join.JoinUtil.createJoinQuery(String, boolean, String, FieldType.LegacyNumericType, Query, IndexSearcher, ScoreMode)
change_description: Because FieldType.LegacyNumericTypeis deprecated, instead use createJoinQuery(String, boolean, String, Class, Query, IndexSearcher, ScoreMode) Method for query time joining for numeric fields. It supports multi- and single- values longs and ints. All considerations from createJoinQuery(String, boolean, String, Query, IndexSearcher, ScoreMode) are applicable here too, though memory consumption might be higher.
source_element_name: org.apache.lucene.search.join.JoinUtil.createJoinQuery(String, boolean, String, FieldType.LegacyNumericType, Query, IndexSearcher, ScoreMode)

This method is deprecated in favor of IOUtils.rethrowAlways(java.lang.Throwable). Code should be updated to IOUtils.rethrowAlways(java.lang.Throwable)and guarded with an additional null-argument check (becauseIOUtils.rethrowAlways(java.lang.Throwable)is not accepting null arguments).

This method is deprecated in favor of IOUtils.rethrowAlways(java.lang.Throwable). Code should be updated to IOUtils.rethrowAlways(java.lang.Throwable)and guarded with an additional null-argument check (becauseIOUtils.rethrowAlways(java.lang.Throwable)is not accepting null arguments).
This evolved into the UnifiedHighlighter; use that instead.

You should not use this ctor, because it uses the thread's context class loader, which is bad programming style. Please specify a reference class or aClassLoader instead.

This is only used by the deprecatedDrillSideways.search(DrillDownQuery, Collector)entry-point. Please use DrillSideways.search(DrillDownQuery, CollectorManager) instead , and leverage DrillSideways.createDrillDownFacetsCollectorManager() as necessary
This class was made public for internal reasons (instanceofchecks). In MMapDirectory it was replaced by MemorySegment based IndexInput implementations and will be no longer required in Lucene 10.

in favour ofBulkScorer.score(LeafCollector, Bits, int, int). Callers should instead call the method variant that takes min and max as arguments, providing 0 andDocIdSetIterator.NO_MORE_DOCSto score the entire segment. Subclasses that override it should instead override its replacement.

the encoded terms will no longer be exposed in a future major version; this is an implementation detail that could change at some point and shouldn't be relied on directly. CallTermInSetQuery.getBytesRefIterator() instead to retrieve over the terms.
